page.title: 02Esholt..Introduction 1
page.content: In 1985,when pupils of Nab Wood Grammar School made their new survey, Esholt was a village of mostly old, corporation-owned houses. The most recently built dated from the turn of the century.Stone for some houses and a community centre came from two demolished woollen mills. Documents show that in 1953 the village had 365 inhabitants,mostly elderly.The nearest doctor lived in Guiseley.The area is still quiet and rural,with a large amount of farm and woodland.Since the 1930s Esholt's most distinctive feature has been its {sewage works}which cut the village off from Apperley Bridge.The road now has a wall across where there was once a toll-gate.It is nationally famous now, however,as the village where Yorkshire Television film their popular drama series{Emmerdale Farm.}
